alert.note: Alert for Kenosha; Milwaukee; Ozaukee; Racine (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 2:55AM CST until January 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO NOON CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, light snow, patchy blowing snow, drifting expected. New snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below to 25 below zero. * WHERE...Ozaukee, Milwaukee, Racine and Kenosha Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST today. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 3 AM to noon CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
